title: Project Setup: Scaffold Next.js App
description: Scaffold standalone Next.js bench-top MVP app with portfolio + item editor routes

title: AI: Pattern Mining Proposals
description: Add pattern mining proposals view and ability to convert proposals into bulk edit drafts
design: Backend task to analyze the 'Other' ActionFamily steps across the synthetic dataset. Cluster similar notes using LLM embeddings or text analysis.
acceptance_criteria: List of proposed action_detail additions; mapping of synonyms; summary report of data quality gaps.

title: UX: Portfolio View
description: Build the portfolio landing page listing menu items (80*) with warning badges for missing method coverage or errors.
design: Main landing page using TanStack Table for item list. Integrate validation warnings from the model.
acceptance_criteria: Filterable item list; warning icons with tooltips; navigation to editor.

title: UX: Item Editor - Scenario Bar
description: Build the scenario configuration bar at the top of the editor to select equipment profiles and customization options.
design: Context-aware selector component. Needs to feed into the resolveSteps function.
acceptance_criteria: Dropdowns for equipment and customizations; state persistence in URL or store.

title: UX: Item Editor - Resolved Steps View
description: Implement the main step list showing the linear result of the scenario resolution.
design: Timeline or Table view showing the linear output of resolveSteps. Highlight provenance.
acceptance_criteria: Clear list of steps; color-coded provenance; rationale visible on hover.

title: UX: Item Editor - Bench View Toggle
description: Add a toggle to show all possible steps (including those filtered out by the scenario) for full bench-top editing.
acceptance_criteria: Toggle switch; greyed-out state for excluded steps; clear visual distinction from resolved view.

title: UX: Item Editor - Step Detail & Operation Drawer
description: Implement side drawers for editing individual step fields and logical operations/methods.
design: Multi-step form for step fields. Integration with BOM component data for target selection.
acceptance_criteria: Operation/Method grouping; searchable BOM picker; override toggle for inherited fields.

title: UX: Scenario Compare Modal
description: Build a modal to compare two scenario outputs side-by-side with a diff report.
acceptance_criteria: Select A and B scenarios; show added/removed steps and field deltas; AI-generated explanation of the diff.

title: Epic: Bench-top Line Build Redesign
description: Modernize line build authoring to solve duplication and BOM disconnect issues.

title: Benchtop MVP UX/Productivity rollout (Beads)
description:
Goal
- Drive impact and productivity in the benchtop line build MVP by making safe, fast, reference-first changes the default.

Context
- App: apps/benchtop-mvp (Next.js App Router)
- Strategy: PRD 'Reference-First Line Builds' (prd-reference-first-line-builds.md)
- Current UX state: strong scenario-first editor + diff + AI surfaces, but many actions are UI-only (no persistence / apply).

Strategic principle (Even/Over)
- Edit references even over editing instances.

Primary user journeys
- Edit one dish quickly (day-to-day authoring)
- Standardize patterns across dishes (bulk edit)
- Make operational changes (equipment/station/tool swaps)
- Validate and publish safely (warn-first -> gate later)
- Learn bottom-up behavior into reusable library (AI-assisted, never required)

Beads (child issues in this epic)
- Bead 1: Faster single-dish editing loop (reduce clicks, linkable scenarios, actionable validation)
- Bead 2: Reference defaults + provenance actions + repeated-target guardrail
- Bead 3: Bulk edit builder (filter -> preview) as a first-class workflow
- Bead 4: Apply + undo + audit log (safety + reversibility)
- Bead 5: AI becomes a change generator (always preview-first)
- Bead 6: Scenario compare -> save as overlay/variant
- Bead 7: Portfolio becomes a work queue + governance surface

Non-goals (MVP)
- Production DB integration
- Perfect action taxonomy
- Fully robot-executable instruction language
design:
UX principles
- Hick's Law: two primary paths everywhere (single dish edit vs portfolio change) + progressive disclosure for advanced fields.
- Doherty Threshold: scenario toggles + previews should feel instant or show clear, tight feedback.
- Peak-End Rule: optimize the safety/clarity of Preview->Apply and Publish moments.

Implementation principle
- Prefer reference-level changes (defaults/inheritance/variants) and make step-level edits a deliberate fallback.
acceptance_criteria:
- All bead issues exist and are linked as parent-child to this epic.
- Dependencies reflect the intended delivery sequence.
- Each bead has clear acceptance criteria and file-level implementation notes.

title: Bead 1 — Faster single-dish editing loop
description:
Goal
- Reduce time/clicks to diagnose + fix an item build in /item/[id].
- Make scenario exploration shareable and repeatable.

Why (ties to PRD + pain points)
- Pain points: steep learning curve, hard to test/preview, manual loops.
- PRD: warn-first validation, previewability, explainability.
- Current state: validations exist but are not actionable; scenario state is not linkable; Settings preference exists but is not applied in the editor.

Scope
- Apply user preference: honor localStorage key `benchtop_default_bench_view` inside the item editor.
- Clickable validation: clicking a warning selects the associated step (and scrolls/visually highlights it).
- Shareable scenario state in URL: encode equipment profile + selected customizations + view mode in query params; restore on load.

Non-goals
- Server persistence; DB integration.
- Full inline editing / bulk apply.

Implementation notes (current code)
- Item editor: apps/benchtop-mvp/src/app/item/[id]/page.tsx
  - state: selectedProfileId, selectedCustIds, benchView, selectedStepId
  - warnings already include `stepId` via validateBuild()
- Settings: apps/benchtop-mvp/src/app/settings/page.tsx
  - already writes localStorage key for bench view
- Consider query params (example):
  - ?profile=profile_turbo&cust=opt1:valA,opt2:valB&view=bench|resolved
  - Keep backward-compatible defaults when params missing.

Risks / edge cases
- Invalid query params (unknown profile/cust) should fall back safely.
- Scrolling to a step row requires stable DOM refs keyed by stepId.
design:
UX
- Keep the primary loop tight: scenario bar -> step list -> fix warning -> re-check.
- Warnings should feel like a work queue: actionable, not informational.

Interaction details
- Clicking a warning:
  - sets selectedStepId
  - ensures the row is scrolled into view
  - flashes highlight for ~1s
- URL updates should be debounced to avoid noisy history; prefer router.replace().
acceptance_criteria:
- When Settings has Default Bench View enabled, opening any /item/[id] defaults to Bench view.
- Copy/paste of the item URL preserves: selected equipment profile, selected customizations, and bench/resolved mode.
- Clicking a validation warning navigates to the associated step (selects + scrolls + highlights).
- Invalid/missing query params do not crash the page; they gracefully fall back.

title: Data: Create Synthetic Fixtures
description: Create synthetic fixture datasets for 80* items, 40* BOM components (with qty/UOM), equipment profiles, and customization values

title: Bead 2 — Reference defaults + provenance actions + repeated-target guardrail
description:
Goal
- Make “edit references, not instances” the default behavior.

Why (ties to PRD + pain points)
- PRD core idea: edit references, not instances; defaults/inheritance are high-ROI.
- Pain points: global changes are hard; BOM↔line build drift causes incidents.
- Current state: provenance is displayed, but users can’t act on it; defaults are read-only fixtures.

Scope
- Defaults editor UI (MVP): edit menuItem↔BOM defaults (station/tool/portion) and immediately see impacted resolved steps.
- Provenance actions:
  - For inherited fields, provide “Why?” + “Edit default” entry points.
  - Jump from a step to the relevant default record.
- Repeated target guardrail (PRD R2):
  - When selecting a target BOM already used in another step, prompt confirmation (“This component is already used in Step X. Add another use?”).

Non-goals
- Perfect governance model for defaults ownership.
- Complex filtering across the entire portfolio (that’s Bead 3+).

Implementation notes
- Data model exists: MenuItemBomDefaults (lib/model/types.ts).
- Resolver already applies inheritance from defaults (lib/model/resolver/index.ts).
- UI hooks point: ProvenanceBadge in item editor currently shows source via title.
- For MVP persistence, consider localStorage-backed overrides layer rather than editing JSON fixtures.

Risks / edge cases
- Multiple steps can legitimately reference the same BOM target; prompt must not block intended duplicates.
- If defaults change, validation counts and resolved steps should update deterministically.
design:
UX
- Prefer “edit default” over “override step” for inherited values.
- Make it obvious which level you’re editing:
  - Reference-level: affects many steps
  - Step-level: affects only this step

Safety
- Always show impact preview (even if small): “X steps affected in this item”.
acceptance_criteria:
- From any inherited Station/Tool badge, user can open the relevant default and edit it.
- Editing a default immediately updates resolved steps + provenance explanations for that menu item.
- Selecting an already-used target prompts a confirm dialog with the earlier step reference.
- User can proceed (duplicate) or cancel (no change) without losing other edits.

title: Bead 3 — Bulk edit builder (filter → preview)
description:
Goal
- Ship the core maintenance loop: Filter → Preview (PRD R3) as a first-class workflow.

Why
- Pain points: no find/replace, no global change capability, high manual burden.
- PRD: bulk editing is the primary win; preview-first safety is non-negotiable.

Scope
- New Changes/Bulk Edit surface (route): /changes (name TBD).
- Filter builder inputs (MVP):
  - target BOM id
  - station/tool
  - action family/detail (where available)
  - equipment/appliance/method (where available)
- Preview outputs:
  - affected menu items count
  - affected steps count
  - before/after diff summary (field-level)
  - validation deltas (warnings added/removed)
  - (optional) scenario diff summary when relevant
- Strategy selection:
  - Reference-level change (defaults)
  - Step-level patch (direct)
  - UI should make the distinction obvious.

Non-goals
- Apply/undo/audit (Bead 4).

Implementation notes
- Use repository fixtures as the portfolio data source (repo is local/synthetic).
- Reuse existing diff/validation/resolver utilities:
  - lib/model/resolver/index.ts
  - lib/model/diff/index.ts
  - lib/model/validation/index.ts
design:
UX
- Hick's Law: start with common bulk edits as presets (Tool swap, Station move, Standardize OTHER).
- Preview should load fast; show progressive loading if necessary.

Safety
- No “Apply” in this bead unless it routes through a clear confirmation step.
acceptance_criteria:
- User can define a filter and see a trustworthy preview list of affected items/steps.
- Preview includes a clear summary: counts + field-level diffs + warning deltas.
- User can choose between reference-level vs step-level change strategies (even if apply is disabled).

title: Bead 4 — Apply + undo + audit (MVP)
description:
Goal
- Make changes safe and reversible: Apply → Audit → Undo.

Why
- Pain points: global changes are risky; no auditable bulk operations.
- PRD: preview-first bulk edits + auditability are required for trust and scale.
- Current state: changes are mostly UI-only; no persistence.

Scope
- Implement Apply for:
  - Reference-level changes (update defaults)
  - Step-level patches (update filtered steps)
- Implement Undo for the most recent change set (single-step rollback).
- Add an Audit Log view:
  - actor, timestamp
  - filter + patch definition
  - counts affected (items/steps)
  - validation delta summary

MVP persistence strategy (pick one)
- Local-only: persist change sets + current state in localStorage.
- OR lightweight in-memory store plus JSON export.

Non-goals
- Multi-user concurrency and permissions.
- Long-term schema migration.

Implementation notes
- Add a minimal “change set” domain object: {filter, patch, strategy, preview, appliedAt, undoPatch}.
- Reuse validateBuild/resolver/diff to compute impact + rollback correctness.
design:
Safety UX
- Apply is always behind Preview + explicit confirmation.
- After apply, show a toast/summary with “Undo” as a primary affordance.
- Audit log is discoverable from /changes.
acceptance_criteria:
- Applying a change modifies the current data model (defaults or steps) and updates previews/resolved steps accordingly.
- Every apply creates an audit record with filter/patch + counts + warning deltas.
- User can undo the last applied change and return to the prior state.

title: Bead 5 — AI becomes a change generator (preview-first)
description:
Goal
- AI outputs structured, previewable change sets that plug directly into the /changes flow.

Why
- PRD: AI should suggest, not block; safety requires preview-first.
- Current state: AI sidebar returns structured JSON, but “Apply to N steps” is not wired and may imply silent changes.

Scope
- AISidebar:
  - “Apply to N steps” opens the bulk edit preview with the proposed filter+patch.
  - Show affected steps in-context (highlight) before user confirms.
- AI Lab:
  - proposals become draft change sets that open in preview.
- Optional: AI-assisted expansion
  - AI suggests additional candidate matches with confidence; user approves to include.

Non-goals
- Fully autonomous edits without review.

Implementation notes
- /api/ai/invoke already returns schemas (filter + patch + confidence).
- Wire routing/state so the result becomes a first-class ChangeSet draft.
design:
UX
- AI never applies directly.
- The “moment of truth” is always the same Preview → Apply flow, whether AI- or user-authored.
- Show confidence and rationale, but keep the default action: preview.
acceptance_criteria:
- AI-generated proposals can be opened as a draft change set in /changes preview.
- No AI action mutates data until a user confirms Apply.
- AI-generated applied changes are recorded in the audit log (same format as manual changes).

title: Bead 6 — Scenario compare → Save as overlay/variant
description:
Goal
- Convert scenario diffs into deterministic, explainable variants/overlays instead of cloning builds.

Why
- Pain points: multi-line build proliferation; equipment/site differences multiply maintenance.
- PRD: bounded predicates + deterministic resolution + explainability.
- Current state: compare modal is profile-only and read-only; overlays exist in model but lack authoring UX.

Scope
- Scenario compare modal:
  - support customizations on both sides (not just profile B)
  - provide “Save as overlay” action for relevant changes
- Overlay editor (MVP):
  - predicate: customization value ids and/or capability
  - overrides: station/tool/time/notes
  - priority ordering
  - “Why did it apply?” explanation

Non-goals
- Full restaurant/site predicate model (can be added later).

Implementation notes
- Model already supports overlays on Step (types.ts).
- Resolver already applies overlays by priority (resolver/index.ts).
design:
UX
- The overlay authoring flow should start from a concrete diff (“save this change as a rule”).
- Show deterministic resolution order and provenance (why this overlay won).
acceptance_criteria:
- User can compare two scenarios (profile + customizations) and generate an overlay rule from a diff.
- After saving, the overlay applies deterministically and the UI can explain why.
- Provenance reflects overlay sourceId.

title: Bead 7 — Portfolio becomes a work queue + governance surface
description:
Goal
- Turn the Portfolio page into the daily “next best action” queue for CE/Ops.

Why
- Pain points: no central view/management; hard to find what to fix; standardization progress is invisible.
- Current state: Portfolio lists items but has limited filters and CTAs; Stats are mostly placeholders.

Scope
- Portfolio filters/sorts:
  - has errors (validateBuild)
  - has OTHER action family
  - has method coverage gaps
  - status draft/published/no build
  - recently updated
- In-row CTAs:
  - Fix warnings (deep-link into /item/[id] with scenario params)
  - Standardize OTHER (open /changes with prefilled filter)
- Light governance metrics:
  - warning count trend (MVP: snapshot-based)
  - OTHER usage count

Non-goals
- Full analytics backend.

Implementation notes
- validateBuild() already computes key warning classes.
- Keep filters client-side for MVP (fixtures).
design:
UX
- Portfolio should feel like a triage board.
- Avoid vanity stats; prioritize actionable counts and direct links.
acceptance_criteria:
- Portfolio can be filtered to show items with errors/warnings and OTHER usage.
- Clicking a CTA takes the user directly to the relevant fix flow (item editor or /changes preview).
- Stats/metrics displayed are computed from current data (not hard-coded).

title: Model: Define Core Types
description: Define TypeScript types for build/step/operation/method/overlay/scenario and persistence interfaces

title: Unit tests: app shell and layout components
description: Write unit tests for app shell (benchtop-x0c.11.1-11.5). Test: route definitions, layout responsiveness, panel resizing, state store synchronization (form→chat→DAG), persistence load/save lifecycle, validation result display. Use React Testing Library + Mock Next.js router.

title: Logic: Implement Scenario Resolver
description: Implement resolveSteps(build, scenario) with inheritance + overlays + provenance

title: Unit tests: structured rules evaluator
description: Write unit tests for benchtop-x0c.7.1 (structured rules evaluator). Test: rule evaluation logic for all rule types, edge cases (empty rules, null fields, malformed data), performance with many rules. Should achieve 80%+ code coverage.

title: Logic: Implement Validation Rules
description: Implement validation rules (required fields, overlay conflicts, method coverage) and warnings UX

title: Logic: Implement Scenario Diff
description: Implement scenario compare + diff report view

title: AI: Port Vertex AI Gemini Client
description: Port Vertex AI Gemini setup from LineBuildPOC (ADC creds + VERTEX_AI_* env vars) and expose minimal AI endpoints
design: Port the VertexAIAdapter from LineBuildPOC. Standardize on @google/genai. Use GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS for ADC. Expose a single /api/ai/invoke endpoint that takes a 'task' type.
acceptance_criteria: Valid Vertex client initialization; successful communication with Gemini 2.5 Flash; env vars configured.

title: Design: form actions contract for chat integration
description: Define which form operations are exposed as CopilotKit actions: addWorkUnit, editWorkUnit, removeWorkUnit, setDependencies, changeBOM. For each action, specify: inputs (which fields), preconditions, outputs (state changes), error cases. Document in schema doc. This informs benchtop-x0c.5.4 implementation.

title: AI: Schema Validation for LLM Outputs
description: Add JSON schema validation for AI outputs (structure suggestions and bulk edit proposals)
design: Use Zod for response validation. Define schemas for each AI task output. Handle parsing of markdown-wrapped JSON from LLM responses.
acceptance_criteria: Robust parsing of LLM JSON; clear error messages for invalid schemas; type safety for LLM results.

title: UX: Add AI Side Panel & Flows
description: Add AI side panel and review/apply flows for suggestions and bulk edit preview/apply
design: Chat-style interface in a right sidebar. Integrated with the scenario context. Buttons to trigger specific AI actions.
acceptance_criteria: Collapsible sidebar; streaming text support; 'Apply' buttons for LLM suggestions that update local state.

title: Unit tests: chat components (message feed, cards)
description: Write unit tests for chat panel components (benchtop-x0c.5.1-5.2). Test: message rendering (user/assistant/system), timestamps, message persistence, card rendering with options, multi/single select modes, click handlers, empty state, scroll behavior. Use React Testing Library.

title: Test: data persistence round-trip (save/load/verify)
description: Test end-to-end persistence for benchtop-x0c.2.1-2.3. Create line build → save JSON → load from file → verify data integrity. Test: all field types, nested structures, special chars in strings, file I/O errors, corrupted JSON recovery.

title: Integration tests: semantic validation + Gemini
description: Write integration tests for benchtop-x0c.7.2 (semantic rules via Gemini). Mock Gemini API. Test: various line builds with realistic semantic rules, timeout handling, API error handling, reasoning extraction. Should have end-to-end test cases from form data → validation results.

title: Unit tests: form components (step list, editor, deps)
description: Write unit tests for form panel components (benchtop-x0c.3.1-3.5). Test: rendering steps, editing fields, dependency selection, adding/removing/reordering steps, BOM autocomplete, state updates to parent. Use React Testing Library.

title: Error handling: validation engine (timeouts, API failures, malformed rules)
description: Implement graceful error handling for validation engine (benchtop-x0c.7.1-7.2). Handle: Gemini API timeouts/failures, rate limiting, network errors, malformed rule definitions, circular dependencies in structured rules. Show user-friendly error messages in validation panel.

title: Error handling: app-level recovery (state, persistence, API)
description: Implement app-level error handling for critical failures. Handle: state store corruption (reset to last-known-good), API errors during load/save (retry with backoff, show toast), network timeouts, CopilotKit connection failures. Persist error logs for debugging. Show user-friendly recovery UI.

title: Error handling: graceful JSON corruption recovery
description: Implement recovery for data layer (benchtop-x0c.2.x) when JSON files are corrupted or malformed. Create backup before save, show recovery UI, allow user to revert to last-known-good state. Log corruption events for debugging.

title: Epic: Line Build Authoring MVP (Fresh Start)
description: Goal: MVP for Shin to author line builds via Chat + read-only DAG + Form, run structured+semantic validation, and use an agentic dashboard for search/bulk edits. No migration work.

title: Epic: Project Setup
Scaffold new Next.js app (apps/line-build-mvp)
Integrate Vertex AI client (Gemini)
Integrate CopilotKit (chat + tool actions)
Define core types (LineBuild, WorkUnit, Override, ValidationRule)
Create mock BOM dataset (7-digit itemId + name)
description:
Create mock BOM dataset with realistic 7-digit item IDs following Cookbook conventions:

## Item Types & IDs
Items have 7-digit IDs where the first digit(s) signify the type:
- **5\* items** (ingredients) — Raw ingredients, lowest-level unit. Maps to procured external items.
- **3\* items** (benchtop recipes) — R&D recipes for reference only; not in production systems.
- **40\* items** (consumable items) — Components used in menu item BOMs.
- **80\* items** (menu items) — Menu items that have line builds. Used in Spork for food production.
- **88\* items** (packaged goods) — Packaged items we produce.
- **9\* items** (guest packaging) — Guest packaging items.

## BOM Structure
- **Menu items (80\*)** have BOMs containing **40\* consumable items**
- BOM contains: input item IDs, quantities, units of measure, output amounts

## Key Rules
- **Publishing Order**: Items cannot be published if they have draft records in their BOM.
- **Cost & Nutrition Flow**: Costs roll up from base items; nutrition values flow through the BOM.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Create mock dataset with ~20-30 items:
  - 5-10 menu items (80\*) with realistic names (e.g., '8001234: Grilled Chicken Bowl')
  - 10-15 consumable items (40\*) for BOM components
  - Sample ingredient items (5\*) for reference
- Include realistic BOM relationships: menu items (80\*) → consumable items (40\*)
- Export as TypeScript constant or JSON for autocomplete and validation use

title: Create sample line build fixtures for UI/testing
Epic: Bulk Edit (agent tools + preview + apply)
Bulk edit: multi-select line builds from results
Agent tools: propose bulk edits across selection
Bulk edit: preview diff before apply
Bulk edit: apply changes (writes JSON)
Epic: App Shell + Routing (Dashboard/Editor/Rules)
App: define routes (Dashboard, Editor, Rules)
description: Route definitions for MVP. Acceptance: Define routes: /dashboard (line build list), /editor?id=[buildId] (editor with chat, DAG, form, validation), /rules (validation rules manager). Routes support query parameters for state (build id, scenario params). All routes have proper layout wrapping (benchtop-x0c.11.2). Navigation between routes works correctly. Back button behavior is predictable.

title: App: editor shell layout (Chat | DAG | Form + Validation panel)
description: App: editor shell layout (Chat | DAG | Form + Validation panel). Acceptance: 3-column responsive layout with Chat (left ~25%), DAG (center ~40%), Form+Validation (right ~35%); columns resizable via draggable dividers; graceful collapse on screens <1200px (stack vertically on mobile); all sub-panels visible on 1920px desktop; consistent 16px padding/8px gaps; 60px header with nav elements; footer optional; keyboard shortcuts for panel focus.

title: App: load/save line build drafts (open by id, persist JSON)
description: App: load/save line build drafts (open by id, persist JSON). Acceptance: Implement load handler (fetch by id from benchtop-x0c.2.1), populate app state (benchtop-x0c.11.4) with loaded build; implement save handler that persists to JSON; save is triggered on form change (debounced) or explicit save button; handle load errors gracefully; show loading state while loading.

title: App: shared state store (form state ↔ chat actions ↔ DAG render)
description: App: shared state store (form state ↔ chat actions ↔ DAG render). Acceptance: Implement global state management (React Context or similar) that syncs: form field changes → triggers chat context update & DAG re-render; chat actions (add step, edit deps) update form; DAG visual reflects current form state; no stale state; support undo/redo or state snapshots.

title: App: orchestrate validation runs + store last-check results
Epic: Data Layer (JSON + Draft/Active)
Implement JSON persistence for line builds
description: JSON persistence for line builds. Acceptance: Implement save/load functions that persist LineBuild objects as JSON files (fs module or IndexedDB). Support load by ID (fetches JSON from file/storage). Support save with conflict prevention (timestamps + backups). All nested fields persist correctly (steps[], dependencies[], overrides[]). JSON readable and debuggable. Error handling for corrupted files (benchtop-u2x).

title: Implement draft/active status model + transitions
description: Implement draft/active status model + transitions. Acceptance: Draft→Active transition blocked if validation has failures; can demote Active→Draft at any time; status persisted in JSON; UI reflects current status.

title: Implement JSON persistence for validation rules
description: JSON persistence for validation rules. Acceptance: Persist ValidationRule objects (both structured and semantic) as JSON. Support load all rules on app startup. Support add/update/delete rule via API or form. Rules available to both validation engines (benchtop-x0c.7.1 and 7.2). JSON format is readable and editable. Rules engine can read persisted rules and apply them.

title: Persist audit trail fields (sourceConversations[], overrides[])
Epic: Editor - Form Panel (linear steps + explicit deps)
Form: Step list (linear, collapsible)
description: Form: Step list (linear, collapsible). Acceptance: Display all steps from loaded line build in vertical list; each step shows ID + BOM name + dependencies badge; step is collapsible/expandable to show full details (WorkUnit tags); can scroll if many steps; clicking step selects it for editing in step editor (benchtop-x0c.3.2); show empty state when no line build loaded; loading state while fetching line build.

title: Form: Step editor for WorkUnit tags
description: Form: Step editor for WorkUnit tags. Acceptance: Display form fields for WorkUnit properties (name, description, estimatedTime, equipmentTags[]); allow edit-in-place for string fields; support array editing for tags (add/remove tags with autocomplete); field validation (required, positive integers); real-time state update when fields change; collapsible sections for advanced fields.

title: Form: dependsOn multi-select (explicit deps)
description: Form: dependsOn multi-select (explicit deps). Acceptance: Render multi-select component showing all other steps (except current); display selected dependencies as chips; allow add/remove via autocomplete dropdown or chip deletion; validate no self-references or circular deps; real-time state update; display dependency count badge on step list item.

title: Form: Add/remove/reorder steps
Form: BOM autocomplete (select by itemId)
description:
Form: BOM autocomplete (select by itemId)

## Item ID Format
Items are 7-digit IDs where first digit(s) indicate type:
- 5\* = Ingredients (raw)
- 40\* = Consumable Items (components in menu item BOMs)
- 80\* = Menu items (have line builds)
- 88\* = Packaged goods
- 9\* = Guest packaging items
Display format: 'itemId: itemName' (e.g., '4001234: Grilled Chicken', '8001234: Grilled Chicken Bowl')

## BOM Context
- Menu items (80\*) have BOMs containing consumable items (40\*)
- When selecting BOM components, filter to show 40\* consumable items

## Acceptance Criteria
- Searchable dropdown filtering mock BOM data (itemId + name)
- Filters as user types (by ID or name)
- Selecting an item populates WorkUnit.bom field
- Handles zero results gracefully
- Keyboard navigation (arrow keys, enter)
- Minimum 2-char search
- Visual distinction for different item types (optional: color-code by prefix)

title: Epic: Editor - DAG Panel (read-only L→R)
DAG view: read-only L→R visualization
DAG view: render edges (hard/soft)
DAG view: sync rendering from form state
DAG view: click node to focus corresponding step
Epic: Editor - Chat Panel (CopilotKit actions + cards)
Chat: UI shell + message history
description: Chat: UI shell + message history. Acceptance: Render message feed with user/assistant/system message bubbles (different styling); auto-scroll to latest; show message timestamps; clear history button with confirmation; integrate with CopilotKit for message handling; system messages (AI instructions/context) passed to Gemini; all messages persist in sourceConversations[] array in JSON; loading state while waiting for API response.

title: Chat: inline cards (interactive option selectors)
description: Chat: inline cards (interactive option selectors). Acceptance: Render card component in chat with title + option list; each option is clickable; selected option is highlighted; click triggers card submit action; cards are responsive on mobile; support multi-select and single-select modes.

title: Chat: card submit sends structured JSON context
Chat: CopilotKit actions to update form/steps
description: CopilotKit tool actions for form updates. Acceptance: Implement CopilotKit useAction hooks for: addWorkUnit (create new step with default values), editWorkUnit (modify name/description/time/tags), removeWorkUnit (delete step), setDependencies (update dependsOn array), changeBOM (select new BOM item). Each action accepts inputs as defined in benchtop-7ql contract. Actions call form state hooks to update form. Real-time UI refresh after action. Support undo/redo if supported by app state (benchtop-x0c.11.4).

title: Chat: human-in-the-loop confirm/deny agent proposals
Epic: Validation Panel (checklist + check-my-work)
Validation UI: checklist panel (read-only status)
Validation UI: 'Check my work' button + run status
description: Button UI: Trigger validation run. Acceptance: Button labeled 'Check my work' with icon; disabled when validation already running; shows spinner while running; disabled while running; after completion, updates validation panel with results; click triggers validation orchestrator (benchtop-x0c.11.5) to run both structured and semantic validation; display success/error toast; show result count in toast.

title: Validation UI: last-checked timestamp + stale indicator
Validation gating: block Draft→Active if failures
description: Validation gating: enforce publish safety. Acceptance: When attempting Draft→Active transition, check validation results. If any failures exist, block transition and show error message. Allow demotion Active→Draft at any time without validation checks. Button/UI clearly communicates validation gate status. Honors both structured and semantic validation results.

title: Epic: Validation Engine (structured + semantic)
Validation engine: structured rules evaluator
Validation engine: semantic rules via Gemini (pass/fail + reasoning)
Semantic rule MVP: flag unrealistic cook times by equipment
Validation engine: normalized result schema (per-rule pass/fail/reasoning)
description: Define normalized ValidationResult schema for both validation engines. Acceptance: Schema includes: ruleId, ruleName, pass (boolean), failures[] (array of failure reasons), reasoning (explanation from Gemini for semantic rules). Both structured evaluator (benchtop-x0c.7.1) and semantic validator (benchtop-x0c.7.2) return results in this schema. Results can be aggregated and displayed in UI (benchtop-x0c.6.1 and 6.2). TypeScript types defined in benchtop-x0c.1.4.

title: Epic: Rules Manager (structured + NL/semantic rules)
Rules Manager: list/create/edit/enable rules
Rules Manager: structured rules form (deterministic)
Rules Manager: semantic rule editor (prompt + guidance)
Rules Manager: natural-language rule drafting (LLM → rule stub)
Rules Manager: test rule against a line build (preview result)
Epic: Dashboard - Agentic Search + Results
Dashboard: line build list (status, last updated)
Dashboard: CopilotKit agent chat (primary search UX)
Agent tools: search line builds by tags/fields
Dashboard: render agent search results + drill-in
Routing: navigate dashboard → editor (by id)
Create demo line build with complex dependencies
description: Create a realistic sample line build fixture with 8-10 steps, multiple dependency chains, several override scenarios. Use real item IDs from sample BOM. Export as JSON fixture for UI testing and user demos. Include documentation of what makes this build 'complex' for validation testing.
